New Records: Saturday marked the first time in Nationals or Expos history that the team swept the Pirates in a doubleheader; it was the 25th time the two clubs had battled in a twin bill.
Key Match Events: The Nationals trailed by two runs heading into the ninth inning, with veteran closer Aroldis Chapman staring them down from the opposing mound at PNC Park.
James Wood got a single to trim the deficit to one run.
Andrés Chaparro’s three-hit game wrapped up with a single to follow.
With two on, former Pirate Ildemaro Vargas sent a flare into right field that ricocheted off outfielder Connor Joe's glove, allowing both runners to score and put Washington ahead.
Keibert Ruiz finished a three-hit night by driving in Vargas on a double to complete the four-run inning.
In Game 1, DJ Herz led a no-hit bid through five innings, which ended with a two-out knock in the seventh.
Kyle Finnegan closed the door on his second save of the day, with four Nats relievers stepping up to pitch both games of the doubleheader.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Martinez praised the team's resilience, stating, 'They didn’t give up, and I talk to these guys every day about them playing hard for the last out, and they did it again today.'
